Dear Mr. Whitney:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 Indicate how continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 Be signed and dated.
A six-month provisional license is recommended as was agreed upon in the Settlement
Agreement. You must submit an acceptable corrective action plan.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.
FOR CWL ONLY
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MSA and your
contract.

ALLEGATION: On 10/28/20, resident and staff member got involved in a physical
altercation. Resident was sent to the emergency room for his injuries.
2

INVESTIGATION:
Incident Report
The completed incident report (coded), dated 10/28/2020 was as follows:
On 10/28/20 at 9:10 pm, Youth A was upset about incident with peers from earlier in the
day. Youth A became verbally aggressive with staff stating, "I'll cut your fucking head
off bitch ass nigger". Youth A, for over 20 minutes threatened to harm Staff 1. Youth A
walked up to Staff 1 and punched him with a closed fist, leading to the two physically
grabbing each other. Youth A stated, "I just touched you 17 times bitch. What are you
going to do". Staff 1 and Youth A separated, and Staff 1 moved himself to another unit
to help de-escalate the situation. Youth A went after the staff that moved units, kicking
down the door of the unit and stabbed Staff 1 with a pen. RCC and SST intervened by
helping to get Staff 1 out of the unit. Youth A ran at Staff 1, chasing Staff 1 with a
broom handle. Staff 1 fled site as Youth A chased him to his car. Youth A alleges that
staff physically aggressed him.
I interviewed State Worker 1 by telephone on 10/29/2020. State Worker 1 stated she
had already visited Youth A at the facility and had taken pictures of Youth A’s injuries.
State Worker 1 reported additional interviews with Youth A were scheduled for
11/05/2020.
On 11/5/2020, I participated in a video interview of Youth A with State Worker 1, Law
Enforcement, and Social Worker 1. Social Worker 1 served as the face to face contact
with Youth A during this interview. Youth A reported the incident under investigation
occurred on Wednesday, 10/28/2020. Youth A stated he had a good morning that day
and the group went to watch a movie that evening following the completion of showers
and chores. Youth A stated a youth left his seat during the movie and when the other
youth did not return Youth A moved to the vacated seat.
Interview Youth A
Youth A stated when the youth returned, the youth told him to move. Youth A stated he
got up and the youth swung at him, after Youth A punched him first. Youth A initiated
the altercation. Youth A stated the staff intervened and he was restrained by Staff 1,
Staff 3, and Staff 4. Youth A alleged Staff 4 punched him in the jaw when Youth A was
going down to the floor and Staff 3 elbowed Youth A in his ear and jaw.
Youth A stated he thought he wanted to fight Staff 4 after he was released from the
restraint because Staff 4 punched him during the restraint. Youth A stated also that a
youth kicked him in the head during the restraint. Youth A stated he was going back to
the unit following the restraint and Staff 1 blocked him because he had threatened to
fight the youth that had kicked him. Youth A stated he tried to push past Staff 1 and
Staff 4 told Youth A that if he pushed staff again, they would “mess him up”. Youth A
said he walked back and punched a white board because he was still upset.
3

Youth A stated Staff 4 then told him to calm down or Youth A would be restrained again.
Youth A stated he told Staff 4, “We can take this outside.” Youth A stated Staff 4 went
outside, and he went to the door .Youth A reported while at the door he overheard two
other staff questioning why Staff 4 would let Youth A get under his skin. Youth A stated
he began to think why should he let Staff 4 get under his skin? In response to
overhearing staff and questioning himself about letting Staff 4 get under his skin; Youth
A began to pace back and forth. Youth A reports that then Staff 1, Staff 3, and Staff 4
then began started calling him, “names.” Youth A responded by saying, “Yea, I’ll be all
of that.” Youth A alleged as Staff 1 was calling him names, Staff 2 would deliberately
bump him. Youth A reported this behavior provoked him, and in response he poked
Staff 1 in the shoulder.
Youth A stated he continued to tap on Staff 1’s shoulder and tell Staff 1, “You said you
were going to punch me”. Youth A stated Staff 2 told Staff 1 he should write Youth A
up. Staff 1 then started to list all the types of offences Youth A could be written up for.
Youth A stated, after hearing this, he then poked Staff 1 again, and Staff 1 punched him
and they began to fight. Youth A stated Staff 2 pushed Staff 1 to make him stop and
Staff 1 backed up. Youth A stated, “I’m not done yet” and he ran at Staff 1 and Staff 1
punched Youth A in the face again.
Youth A stated Staff 1 then left the unit and Youth A passed through another area to
fight with Staff 1 again in another unit. Youth A stated Staff 1 then went back to the
original unit where the fight has started. Youth A stated he went to the cafeteria to get a
spoon to try to open the door to go after Staff 1 again. Youth A stated Staff 1 called to
Staff 2 to relieve Staff 1 so Staff 1 could leave. Youth A said Staff 1 went out the back
door and Youth A grabbed a broomstick and went outside to go after Staff 1. Youth A
stated he told Staff 1, “I thought you wanted to fight”.
Youth A said Staff 1 did not initially say anything to him but continued to walk to his car.
Youth A alleged Staff 1 then said as Staff 1 walked to his car that Youth A was lucky
that he did not go home and come back and shoot him. Youth A reported he said,
“Yeah, but you’re not going to do it”. Youth A said he stuck the broomstick in the grass
and went inside.
Medical Attention for Youth A
A medical evaluation was completed for Youth A on 10/28/2020. The diagnosis
identified on this exam was “left eyelid laceration, initial encounter,” and “contusion of
cheek, initial encounter.” Imaging was also completed on Youth A’s head and elbow. A
suture was applied for the laceration near the eye.
Interview with Youth B
On 11/09/2020, I interviewed Youth B by telephone with State Worker 1 at the facility.
Youth B said she was half asleep when she heard a sound that was Staff 1 dropping
Youth A onto the floor. Youth B said Staff 1 hit Youth A in the face 4 or 5 times and
Youth A was backing up. Youth B stated Youth A grabbed Staff 1 by the torso and Staff
4

1 picked Youth A up and dropped Youth A to the floor. Youth B said other residents
went to get help and Youth A left the room. Youth B stated that, “she did not see Youth
A hit Staff 1 and Youth A was blocking Staff 1”. Youth B stated Staff 2 was telling Staff
1 to stop.
Interview with Youth C
On 11/09/2020, I interviewed Youth C by telephone with State Worker 1 at the facility.
Youth C stated Youth A entered Youth C’s unit and Youth C saw Staff 1 push Youth A
back. Youth C stated Youth A stabbed Youth C in the foot with an ink pen. Youth C
stated, “Youth A will be aggressive for no reason”. Youth C stated he had never seen
Staff 1 be aggressive like that. Youth C stated Staff 1 was crying when Staff 1 left
because Staff 1 knew he blew it.
Interview with Youth D
I interviewed Youth D on 11/09/2020 by telephone with State Worker 1 at the facility.
Youth D stated Youth A was irritating Staff 1. Youth D said Youth A kept in Staff 1’s
face and Staff 2 came into the room and Staff 1 punched Youth A in the eye. Staff 2
sent Staff 1 out. Youth D said he saw Staff 1 hit Youth A once. Youth D stated Youth A
had something hard to hit over the window or door.
Youth D stated that during the incident when the residents were watching a movie
Youth C asked Youth A several times nicely for Youth A to give Youth C his seat back.
Youth D stated Staff 3 kept between Youth A and Youth C and Youth A attempted to
swing past Staff 3 to hit Youth C. Youth D stated Staff 1, Staff 3, and Staff 4 restrained
Youth A during that incident. Youth D stated he did not see any staff members hit
Youth A during the restraint incident. Youth D stated another resident did kick Youth A
in the face during the restraint. Youth D said everyone was sent back to their units and
Youth A and Staff 4 went outside, Youth A wanted to fight Staff 4 but Staff 1 grabbed
Youth A from behind and brought Youth A back to the unit.
I interviewed State Worker 1 by telephone on 11/17/2020. State Worker 1 stated she
participated in interviews with Staff 3 and Staff 4 with law enforcement on Friday
11/13/2020. State Worker 1 stated the interviews were scheduled at the last minute by
law enforcement and State Worker 1 was unable to contact me to participate. State
Worker 1 stated Staff 4 reported Youth A had a small cut that was bleeding by Youth
A’s eye following the restraint of Youth A when Youth A was kicked by another resident.
State Worker 1 stated that Staff 3 reported he did not notice the injury to Youth A at that
time, but when Youth A and Staff 1 entered their unit following the first skirmish between
Youth A and Staff 1, Youth A was bleeding, his face/eye was swollen and there was
blood around Youth A’s mouth.
Interview with Staff 1
I interviewed Staff 1 on 12/07/2020 with law enforcement and State Worker 1. Staff 1
stated Youth A was agitated from an earlier fight that day with another youth. Staff 1
stated they were keeping Youth A out of the lodge in attempting to deescalate Youth A.
Staff 1 stated Youth A was still agitated when Youth A returned to the unit. Staff 1
5

stated he asked Staff 2 to relieve Staff 1. Staff 1 stated Youth A was calling Staff 1 the
“B” word and “N” word and getting in Staff 1’s face. Staff 1 stated Youth A attempted to
push Staff 1 but Staff 1 was already backed into the wall. Staff 1 stated Youth A
punched Staff 1 twice and said Staff 2 was a witness to Youth A punching Staff 1. Staff
1 stated he did not punch back, and Staff 2 told Staff 1 to go to another unit. Staff 1
stated that Youth A somehow got into the unit that Staff 1 had moved to and Youth A
tried to stab Staff 1 with a pen. Staff 1 said he didn’t get stabbed, but Staff 1 said he
started to go to his car to get away from the situation. Staff 1 stated Youth A had a
broomstick and attempted to follow Staff 1 to the car to hit Staff 1. Staff 1 said he got
into his car before Youth A could reach Staff 1. Staff 1 denied ever taking Youth A
down or punching Youth A. Staff 1 stated the injuries to Youth A were from Youth A’s
earlier fight with another youth. Staff 1 stated he did not see the earlier fight Youth A
had with another youth, but Youth A had a scar, slight bleeding around his eye, and
dried blood around Youth A’s nose. Staff 1 denied being a part of the restraint of Youth
A when Youth A was kicked by another youth.
Interview with Staff 2
I interviewed Staff 2 on 12/16/2020 with law enforcement and State Worker 1 at the
facility. Staff 2 stated he was not involved in the restraint of Youth A that occurred
earlier in the day prior to the event under investigation. Staff 2 stated he was doing a
walk through the area and observed Youth A yelling at Staff 1. Staff 2 stated Youth A
punched Staff 1 in the face with Youth A’s right hand. Staff 2 described Staff 1 as
backing up and attempting to get away from Youth A. Staff 2 stated he told other youth
to go for help. Staff 2 stated Youth A broke the door to go after Staff 1 who had left the
area. Staff 2 stated Youth A had a pen and Youth A had said he had stabbed Staff 1
with the pen, but Staff 2 didn’t know if Youth A had stabbed Staff 1 or not. Staff 2 stated
Youth A got a broom handle and chased Staff 1 outside when Staff 1 was going to his
car. Staff 2 stated he did not observe Youth A being put to the ground or see Staff 1 hit
Youth A during the incident. Staff 2 described Youth A as having a small scratch on his
face from an earlier incident, but it was not bleeding. Staff 2 described Youth A as
bleeding from his lip and around his eye when Youth A came back from being outside
chasing Staff 1.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.158 Discipline.
(2) An institution shall prohibit all cruel and severe
discipline, including any of the following:
(a) Any type of corporal punishment inflicted in any
manner.
6

ANALYSIS: The findings of this investigation substantiate the allegation that
Staff 1 and Youth A engaged in a physical altercation that left
Youth A with injuries to his eye and face. The findings
determined both Youth A and Staff 1 were the aggressors at
different times during the ongoing incident.
Repeat Violation Established –
SIR #2020C0325062, dated 09/28/2020, Recommend
Revocation
SIR #2020C0325004, dated 06/26/2019, CAP Approval
12/15/2019
SIR #2020C0106039, dated 05/11/2020, Recommend
Modification to 1st Provisional, CAP Approval 10/19/2020
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4109 Program statement.
(1) An institution shall have and follow a current written
program statement which specifically addresses all of the
following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission,
care, safety, and supervision, methods for addressing
residents' needs, implementation of treatment plans, and
discharge of residents.
7

ANALYSIS: The findings of this investigation determined Staff 1 violated the
policies and procedures of this facility by engaging in a physical
fight with Youth A instead of deescalating the situation or calling
for assistance to relieve Staff 1 from escalating the situation.
Repeat Violation Established –
SIR #2020C0217036, dated 07/16/2020, CAP Approval
08/27/2020
SIR #2019C0325054, dated 07/15/2019, CAP Approval
10/30/2019
SIR #2019C0325030, dated 03/14/2019, CAP Approval
05/16/2019
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
qualifications.
(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Analysis: The findings of this investigation indicated Staff 1 does not
have the ability to perform the duties of the position assigned.
Staff 1 did not maintain the self-control required to abstain
from a physical confrontation with Youth A.
Repeat Violation Established –
SIR #2020C0325062, dated 09/28/2020, No CAP Approval
SIR#2020C0106039, dated 05/11/2020, CAP Approval
10/19/2020
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable CAP, the recommendation is consistent with the
Settlement Agreement.
